maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Service Bus namespace.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Service Bus queue in the specified Service Bus namespace.
The New-AzureRmServiceBusQueue cmdlet creates a new Service Bus queue in the specified Service Bus namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.
The Service Bus namespace name.
The Service Bus queue name.
Specifies the TimeSpan (https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.timespan.aspx)idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies whether messages are deadlettered on expiration.
Specifies the default message time-to-live (TTL).

Specifies the duplicate detection history time window, a TimeSpan (https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.timespan.aspx)valuethat defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Specifies whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Specifies whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.
Specifies whether EnablePartitioning is enabled.
Specifies whether the message is anonymously accessible.
Specifies the lock duration.
Specifies the maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries.
Specifies the maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.
Specifies the number of messages in the queue.
Specifies whether the queue requires duplicate detection.
Specifies whether this queue supports sessions.
The size of the queue in bytes.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the TimeSpan (https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.timespan.aspx)idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

Specifies the default message time-to-live (TTL).

Specifies whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Specifies whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.
Specifies whether EnablePartitioning is enabled.
Specifies whether the message is anonymously accessible.
Specifies the lock duration.
Specifies the maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries.
Specifies the maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.
Specifies the number of messages in the queue.
The Service Bus namespace name.
The Service Bus queue name.
Specifies whether the queue requires duplicate detection.
Specifies whether this queue supports sessions.
The name of the resource group.

Specifies the TimeSpan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.
Specifies the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus.
Specifies the TimeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.
Specifies whether to enable the topic to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
Specifies whether to enable subscription partitioning.
Indicates whether filtering is enabled for messages before publishing.
Indicates whether the message allows anonymous access.
Indicates whether the topic is express enabled.

Indicates whether the topic requires duplication detection.

Indicates whether the topic supports ordering.

Rights; for example, @("Listen","Send","Manage"). Required if -AuthruleObj is not specified.
The Service Bus topic name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Id : /subscriptions/854d368f-1828-428f-8f3c-f2affa9b2f7d/resourceGroups/Default-ServiceBus-WestUS/providers/Microsoft.ServiceBus/namespaces/SB-Example1/topics/SB-Topic_exampl1/authorization Rules/SBTopicAuthoRule1 Type : Microsoft.ServiceBus/AuthorizationRules Name : SBTopicAuthoRule1 Location : West US Tags : Rights : {Listen, Send, Manage}

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $authRuleObj = Get-AzureRmServiceBusTopicAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroup Default-ServiceBus-WestUS -NamespaceName SB-Example1 -TopicName SB-Topic_exampl1 -AuthorizationRuleName SBTopicAuthoRule1
PS C:\> $authRuleObj.Rights.Add("Manage")
PS C:\> Set-AzureRmServiceBusTopicAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroup Default-ServiceBus-WestUS -NamespaceName SB-Example1 -TopicName SB-Topic_exampl1 -AuthRuleObj $authRuleObj

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds Manage to the access rights of the authorization rule `SBTopicAuthoRule1` on topic `SB-Topic_exampl1`.
